abstracts.cdata!:
The Project seeks to preserve diverse
            landscapes among protected natural areas, through productive
            approaches for the sustainable use of bio-diversity, in ways
            compatible with conservation, and economically natural
            resource management models, attractive to the population,
            but particularly respectful of indigenous cultures, and
            people. This environmental assessment (EA) reviews the legal
            framework on indigenous rights, which articulates social
            promotion, and guaranteed access to justice, particularly
            addressing their legal practices, and customs on land
            ownership, and tenure rights. The EA examines the cultural
            diversity, and socioeconomic profiles in the area, drawing
            strategic lines based on consultations with indigenous
            communities, and on institutional capacity to execute
            environmental planning. Mitigation measures will be staged
            between the years 2001-2004 as follows. Organizational
            capacity will be strengthened, by sharing experiences,
            preparing communal technical tables for management, and
            administrative practices within participatory approaches.
            Sustainable production, and conservation will be promoted
            through training on agro-ecology, forestry management, and
            organic production, aiming at stabilizing, promoting, and
            marketing basic production. Access to environmental programs
            will be ensured, within the institutional framework, and
            monitoring/evaluation systems.
